Activities commonly implemented under this intervention

Optimize the beef value chain of calf production, intermediate fattening, and finishing.
Undertake territorial planning to identify and develop reproductive regions (drier) and fattening regions (wetter).
Develop transportation networks to transport livestock to and from fattening areas.
Optimize the offtake rate (the proportion of the herd that is sold or consumed each year).
Create a market demand for products of fattening activities.

Guidance for increased animal health sustainability

P2.P5. Foster systems for data collection, monitoring and traceability.
P2.P3. Promote the development and distribution of guidelines for livestock health and welfare during transport. FAWC 2009.
P2.P4 P5. Raise awareness about Food safety measures and Good Farming Practices and biosecurity to reduce the risk of animal diseases and zoonoses
P1.P3.P6. Explore the market of opportunity for animal reared within the used of AM (i.e. “organic product”), produced under enhanced welfare conditions (i.e. free range) and under environmental criteria of sustainability.
